subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Anyone else offended by C2C?
author: Paul McGaugh
full_text:
--0-1678031584-1254509913=:73837
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I'm not offended by Coast to Coast.=A0 Skepticism or unbelive is part of th=
e package you accept when you are involved in the paranormal.=A0 Coast to C=
oast has helped open people's eyes to the paranormal.

As I slip into tempo=
rary insanity....One of my projects is trying to find intelligent life here=
 in Las Vegas.=A0 For some reason I don't get any voices from the living--t=
he dead are no problem.=A0 I'm sure the skeptics say "Oh no, there's no int=
elligent life here in Nevada."=A0 I say, "There's no living intelligent lif=
e here."=A0=A0Nevada's last in education and we're trying hard to become nu=
mber one in teenage pregnancy!=A0 We won't stop till all the records fall!=
=A0 Anyway, some of the EVPs I capture here are about gambling, smoking and=
 drinking.=A0 Sounds about right for Vegas doesn't it?=A0 I was thinking ab=
out asking some of the spirits out for a night of gambling.=A0 I bet it wou=
ld be a nice advantage and some of these guys probably have a mean poker ga=
me anyway.

I'll end on this insanity.=A0 Mississippi is leading the nation=
 in obesity as Nevada jealously watches.=A0 Nevada parents have ordered the=
ir children to not stop eating so Nevada can top Mississippi.=A0 I'll keep =
you informed on the progress.=A0 Watch out Mississippi, here we come!=A0 In=
 the meantime, I'm=A0leave now and do=A0my part by eating three whopper com=
bos and a shake--at McDonalds.=A0 If intelligent life is found here, unfort=
unately it won't be me.

On a serious note, I've noticed that as the moon i=
s full my voices come in clearer and clearer.=A0 Several weeks ago I was ge=
tting absolutely nothing then as the moon is becoming full it's really pick=
ed up.=A0 The moon should be full in the next day or two so I really expect=
 good comms.

We have the Gold Hill Hotel here in Nevada.=A0 It's one of th=
e most haunted places in the world.=A0 It would be cool if I could set up a=
 trip to go ghost hunting there, but that would be like a little leaguer st=
epping up to the major leagues.=A0 Even seasoned mediums have left that pla=
ce in fear never to return.=A0 Maybe I should call the tour, "Night of the =
Unholy Living Hell."=A0 Would that sale, or frighten off people?

cheers

P=
aul




________________________________
From: Alan <alan.story@...>
=
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Fri, October 2, 2009 9:47:40 AM
Subject: =
[EVP-ITC] Re: Anyone else offended by C2C?

=A0 
I think C2C is one of the =
few media places where EVP, Spiritualism, Mediumship, Ghost-hunting, and th=
ings of that nature get a fair hearing. I think George Noory does a great j=
ob of extending courtesy towards his guests and listeners. Hell, how many t=
imes has Frank been on C2C? People obviously react or he wouldn't be brough=
t back.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@. ..> wrote=
:
>
> In my mind the word "skeptic" is a misnomer. There is a difference be=
tween a
> skeptic and an unbeliever.
> 
> If I said "I'm skeptical about yo=
ur rebuilding that engine" I would admit
> that it's possible, just doubt t=
hat you're going to do it. An unbeliever
> wouldn't believe that it's even =
possible to rebuild engines.
> 
> I think most of the "skeptics" we see in =
any sort of paranormal sphere are
> really unbelievers. As Frank pointed ou=
t, they don't even believe or
> recognize that we ARE spirits, so how could=
 a ghost exist and how could the
> box work? A ghost could hit them in the =
head with a 2X4 and they still
> wouldn't believe it.
> 
> Zack
> 
> On Fri=
, Oct 2, 2009 at 3:22 AM, ourobouros2k2 <ourobouros2k2@ ...>wrote:
> 
> >
>=
 >
> > Not to mention that when they want to "test" something they are alre=
ady
> > skeptical about, then they will come up with impossible criteria. T=
he day I
> > finally stopped caring why a ghost box worked and just accepte=
d that it did
> > was the start of rewarding sessions.
> >
> > I think most=
 of us are beyond the point where skeptics can make a dent in
> > our searc=
hing for answers. Skepticism can be good, but sometimes it can be
> > self =
defeating. More people just want to make a name for themselves by
> > tryin=
g to be the one that brought down this or that device. If they would
> > tr=
y some of these methods with an open mind and a brief suspension of
> > dis=
belief, then they might get their own rewarding experiences as well...
> >
=
> > Andy
> >
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogro ups.co=
m>,
> > "purplespacefriend" <purplealiengirl@ > wrote:
> > >
> > > Well the=
n, just build youself a box and test the hell out of it!
> > >
> > > I've s=
aid all along that one has to be careful not to create the
> > voices/answe=
rs one wants to hear. We are, despite appearances, spirit, and
> > we can c=
reate our own spirit voices just as easy as any other entity. But
> > what =
do I know, I just make the damn boxes and I don't even believe in ghost
> >=
 hunting!?
> > >
> > > Whatever these brainiacs claim that want to do all t=
his testing--they
> > never-ever ask the freaking inventors! They can't eve=
n get their heads
> > around EVPmaker, so pretend that doesn't even exist, =
even though the box
> > came later. Probably they think it would be easier =
to disprove the box. Some
> > duffus puts a DR. in front of his name and I'=
m supposed to be impressed, it
> > just means all intellect has been progra=
mmed out. After all , they "know"
> > there are no spirits, so it has to be=
 something else--anything else!
> > >
> > > Frank-S
> > >
> >
> > 
> >
>


=

ad><body><div style=3D"font-family:times new roman, new york, times, serif;=
font-size:12pt"><DIV>I'm not offended by Coast to Coast.  Skepticism o=
r unbelive is part of the package you accept when you are involved in the p=
aranormal.  Coast to Coast has helped open people's eyes to the parano=
rmal.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>As I slip into temporary insanity....One=
 of my projects is trying to find intelligent life here in Las Vegas. =
 For some reason I don't get any voices from the living--the dead are no pr=
oblem.  I'm sure the skeptics say "Oh no, there's no intelligent life =
here in Nevada."  I say, "There's no living intelligent life here."&nb=
sp; Nevada's last in education and we're trying hard to become number =
one in teenage pregnancy!  We won't stop till all the records fall!&nb=
sp; Anyway, some of the EVPs I capture here are about gambling, smoking and=
 drinking.  Sounds about right for Vegas doesn't it?  I was think=
ing about asking some of the spirits out for a night of gambling.  I b=
et it would be a nice advantage and some of these guys probably have a mean=
 poker game anyway.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I'll end on this insanity.=
  Mississippi is leading the nation in obesity as Nevada jealously wat=
ches.  Nevada parents have ordered their children to not stop eating s=
o Nevada can top Mississippi.  I'll keep you informed on the progress.=
  Watch out Mississippi, here we come!  In the meantime, I'm&nbsp=
;leave now and do my part by eating three whopper combos and a shake--=
at McDonalds.  If intelligent life is found here, unfortunately it won=
't be me.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>On a serious note, I've noticed that=
 as the moon is full my voices come in clearer and clearer.  Several w=
eeks ago I was getting absolutely nothing then as the moon is becoming full=
 it's really picked up.  The moon should be full in the next day or tw=
o so I really expect good comms.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We have the G=
old Hill Hotel here in Nevada.  It's one of the most haunted places in=
 the world.  It would be cool if I could set up a trip to go ghost hun=
ting there, but that would be like a little leaguer stepping up to the majo=
r leagues.  Even seasoned mediums have left that place in fear never t=
o return.  Maybe I should call the tour, "Night of the Unholy Living H=
ell."  Would that sale, or frighten off people?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV=
>
<DIV>cheers</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Paul<BR></DIV>
